snippet: In a country where politics and public life were for generations violently and obsessively policed, young people are now speaking more freely than ever.
abstract: Tripoli Journal; Libya is experiencing a renaissance of free speech following revolution, as newspapers, graffiti artists and even rappers express political opinions that once may have cost them their lives; many find the new freedoms both exhilarating and disorienting.
lead_paragraph: In a country where politics and public life were for generations violently and obsessively policed, young people are now speaking more freely than ever.

headline.seo: Young Libyans Revel in Freedom to Speak Out
headline.main: Now Able to Exhale, Libyan Rappers Find a Voice
headline.print_headline: Now Able to Exhale, Libyan Rappers Find a Voice

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
